ovdesc.p: Customer Preferences is a user friendly interface for creating records in DE.PRODUCT.
The record can be created for a CUSTOMER or an Account. For each Message Group (from the new DE.MESSAGE.GROUP table), customer can define the following:
a) Carrier in which the messages should be sent through
b) Address version where the message has to be delivered
c) Special format of the message
e) Copy customer - the other customer/employee to receive that message group
g) The blackout SMS start and end times
h) The local time offset from UST.
When the Preferences are set and the record is authorised, DE.PRODUCT records will be created and DE.ADDRESS for the customer SMS addresses will be updated with the blackout start and end time.

desc.p: Specifies the format version to be used, and must always be '1' if the formatting module is SWIFT.
1) 1-2 numeric characters
2) Optional Input
3) Defaults to 1
Specifies the Key of DE.PRODUCT record which will be
created on authorisation of this Customer preferences
Validation rules:
1)System updated field
Flag to force the rebuild of the DE.PRODUCT keys updated in Customer preferences
DE.PRODUCT.ID keys will be generated based on Message type defined in DE.MESSAGE.GROUP
When DE.MESSAGE.GROUP is modified ,then corresponding Customer Preferences record need to
be rebuild.
1) Tick box field.

Provides an option to the user to specify if the Preference details provided in the associated set of fields of Carrier, Address are indeed correct and messages could be triggered by the system. Otherwise, the details entered will be treated as informatory or yet to be confirmed.
1)1 to 3 Alpha numeric Characters
2)Can be YES or NO
When ‘YES’ is opted, DE.PRODUCT records will be created and delivery messages will be triggered. Option ‘NO’ will not trigger the creation of DE.PRODUCT records.
When an ‘YES’ option is changed to ‘NO’, all related preference details will be removed from DE.PRODUCT
Holds the time zone differences between the customer’s Home time zone and UST (Universal Standard Time).
Validation rules:
Entered in +HH:MM or –HH:MM format ,
Example, Customer in Paris will enter +01:00 hours and Customer in Central America will enter -06:00 hours denoting time difference with UST
Specifies the language to be used for messages
1)1-2 A (alphanumeric) characters. (A valid language mnemonic.)
2) Optional input. If it is not entered the 1st language in the LANGUAGE table will be used.
If entered it must be a key to the LANGUAGE table.
Specifies the number of copies of a message required.
1)1-3 numeric characters
2)Allowed only for Print carrier
3)Not valid for formatting carrier module of 'SWIFT'.
4)Default value is'1'
Specify other Customers for whom a copy of the message needs to be sent.
Validation rules:
1)Valid customer
2)Copy customers will be updated in DE.PRODUCT only for PRINT,SMS and EMAIL carriers
Key to this application is a Customer number or an Account number facilitating the user to provide message preferences in terms of selecting carrier, address, related customers to be copied and so.
Validation rules:
1)Key can be valid Customer number or A-Account number
2)DE.PRODUCT records will be created / updated using the MESSAGE.GROUP and PREFERENCE.ID as the id.
Specifies the Version of address to which the message should be sent to.
Validation rules:
1)Mandatory Input
2)Address version number must be 1-3 numeric character
3)Record must exist in DE.ADDRESS file with this version specific to the Carrier.
Indicates the End time of blackout period.
It is possible to specify one or more time periods using fields BLACKOUT.START and BLACKOUT.END
during which customer may not wish to receive a SMS message during a day.
Validation rules
1)Time should be entered in HH:MM format (24 hour format).
HH – denoting hours and MM - denoting minutes
2) Applicable to SMS carrier only. Valid only for SMS carrier
Indicates the start time of blackout period.
It is possible to specify one or more time periods using fields BLACKOUT.START and BLACKOUT.END
during which customer may not wish to receive a SMS message during a day.
Validation rules:
1)Time should be entered in HH:MM format (24 hour format).
HH – denoting hours and MM - denoting minutes
2)Applicable to SMS carrier only.
Specifies the Carrier to be used for sending messages
Validation rules:
1)Mandatory Input
2)Carrier must reference a record on the carrier definition file, DE.CARRIER
3) Must be in the list of outward carriers on DE.PARM.
Contains all the override messages which the user has
confirmed during input.
At validation,the system may generate a series of screen
override messages to indicate some anomaly within the
transaction (e.g. maturity date is not a working day for
this currency). User may change the data or override the
message.
(System generated. Multivalue field.)
This is a NOINPUT field.
Specifies the Customer‘s SMS address to define the blackout periods. During the blackout period, SMS message will not reach the Customer.
Validation rules
SMS address should be defined in the format like SMS.1, SMS.2 where SMS.1 represents the first SMS number provided in Customer table, SMS.2 represents the second SMS number in Customer table.
Specifies the Message group name that provides details of all Messages to be triggered.
Validation rules:
1)Must be a valid entry in DE.MESSAGE.GROUP
